steps.heading: Straight lines
steps.content: Straight lines can be drawn by left clicking, the first click will leave an orange dot.

steps.heading: Straight lines
steps.content:
The Second click will draw the line.
Only passes can be drawn as straight lines when using touch screen devices.

steps.heading: Curved lines
steps.content:
Curved lines can be drawn by right clicking and moving the mouse.
When using touch screen devices, all lines will be drawn curved except for passes.

steps.heading: Note
steps.content: File => Settings allows you to reverse the mouse buttons used to draw curved and straight lines.

steps.heading: Arrow
steps.content: Indicate player movement with an arrow.

steps.heading: Dribble
steps.content: Indicate dribbling.

steps.heading: Screen
steps.content: Indicate a screen.

steps.heading: Pass
steps.content: Indicate a pass with a dashed line. Note: passes are always straight lines.

steps.heading: The ball
steps.content: Add the player with the ball.

steps.heading: X's, and O's
steps.content: Add X's and O's to represent more players as needed.

steps.heading: Player Icons
steps.content: The icons used for X's and O's may be changed using Edit => Change Player Icons

steps.heading: Applying players
steps.content: To add a player name to an X, O or ball, right click it and select the appropriate player.

steps.heading: Editing players
steps.content: Click Edit => Players to open the player dialog.

steps.heading: Creating new players
steps.content: To add a new player click New Player and fill out the form.

steps.heading: Importing players
steps.content: If you have a list of players in another document you would like to use, click Import Players and select the appropriate file.

steps.heading: Editing players
steps.content: To edit a player, click on their name.

steps.heading: Deleting players
steps.content:
To delete players put a check mark next to unnecessary players, then click delete. In the example, only Joe Smith will be deleted.

If you accidentally delete a player click Edit => Undo.

steps.heading: Adding Text Boxes
steps.content: Text boxes may be added by clicking the text box icon, or using Edit => Insert Text Box.

steps.heading: Deleting Text Boxes
steps.content: Text boxes may be deleted by clicking the red X in the upper right corner of the text box.

steps.heading: Renaming frames
steps.content: Use: Edit => Rename Frame, Ctrl + r, or double click the text above the current frame to rename one or more frames.

steps.heading: Adding frames
steps.content: Click the + icon to add a frame after the current frame.

steps.heading: Continuing plays on the next frame
steps.content: Click the down arrow next to the + icon to continue the current play. The players will automatically be moved to the locations you specified on the previous frame.

steps.heading: Deleting frames
steps.content: Use: Edit => Delete Frame, or use DELETE key to delete the current frame.

steps.heading: Selecting frames
steps.content: Shift + Click or Ctrl + click may be used to select multiple frames.

steps.heading: Generating a PDF
steps.content: File => PDF; Create

steps.heading: Frames per page
steps.content: Select either 2 or 6 half courts per page.

steps.heading: Printer friendly
steps.content: The Printer friendly option makes the lane white.

steps.heading: Selection Only
steps.content: This option makes a PDF of only the selected frames.

steps.heading: Printing
steps.content: File => Print may be used to print the current document, (See PDF section above for details).

steps.heading: Opening
steps.content: File => Open, use the dialog to locate a PlayWrite (.plrt) file, double click it to open it.

steps.heading: Saving
steps.content: File => Save, if the file has been saved once it will be updated in its current location. To save the file somewhere else, use Save As. The file will be saved as a PlayWrite (.plrt) file. </br>Use File => Save As to specify the location in which to save the file.

steps.heading: Search
steps.content: To search the document or multiple documents for text or players, click Edit => Search.

steps.heading: About
steps.content: File => Settings allows you to reverse the mouse buttons used to draw curved and straight lines.
